understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method that returns the batch size failure threshold in kilobytes.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is directly related to the configuration as it retrieves the batch size failure threshold value from the configuration file.

config_description: Fail any multiple-partition batch exceeding this value. 50kb (10x warn threshold) by default.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'batch_size_fail_threshold_in_kb' is used to determine the threshold at which a multiple-partition batch will fail. It is retrieved using the method getBatchSizeFailureThreshold() which internally calls DatabaseDescriptor.getBatchSizeFailThresholdInKB().
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'batch_size_fail_threshold_in_kb' configuration depends on the batch size of multiple-partition batches being processed. If a batch exceeds the specified threshold, it will trigger the configuration.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'batch_size_fail_threshold_in_kb' configuration option is that it helps in preventing large multiple-partition batches from causing issues in the system by failing them when they exceed the specified threshold. This helps in maintaining system stability and performance.
